meanings.definition: Overly advanced in culture and society.
meanings.sent1: The hypercivilized city had towering buildings and advanced technology.
meanings.sent2: The hypercivilized society valued art, education, and technology.
meanings.sent3: In the hypercivilized town, even the pets attended etiquette classes.
meanings.sent4: The hypercivilized world seemed like a utopia of progress and knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The hypercivilized civilization was a beacon of culture and sophistication.

meanings.definition: To make more advanced in culture and society.
meanings.sent1: The explorer wanted to hypercivilize the remote tribe by introducing modern practices.
meanings.sent2: The government aimed to hypercivilize the rural areas through infrastructure development.
meanings.sent3: The eccentric inventor tried to hypercivilize his robot assistant with manners and etiquette.
meanings.sent4: The teacher sought to hypercivilize her students by exposing them to diverse cultures.
meanings.sent5: The mission of the organization was to hypercivilize underdeveloped regions around the world.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive refinement and sophistication.
meanings.sent1: The hypercivilized gentleman always wore a suit and tie, even at home.
meanings.sent2: The hypercivilized party featured classical music and elegant decor.
meanings.sent3: The hypercivilized cat refused to drink water unless it was in a crystal bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her hypercivilized manners made her stand out in the casual gathering.
meanings.sent5: The hypercivilized artwork displayed intricate details and exquisite craftsmanship.
